content:
Posted: April 5, 2016
												I disliked this game very much, not for any of the aesthetics, that doesnt' really phase me. I dislike it because it handles very poorly. Every object is as light as a feather, flying any which way at the slightest lateral movement. However, your gravity gun is extremely weak and makes it hard to manuever and it doesn't really get easier with time. It gets very frustrating very easily after a few levels and the respawn time (about 5 seconds) is way too much between deaths for a platformer like this where dying and restarting are necessary to explore the levels and how to deal with them. For the price (especially on sale) it's not awful, may as well be free, but I still with I could get my money back. Oh well, interesting concept, wish it had been done better.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
												BEEP is a fun game including simple and more advanced puzzles, a cute story, cute world, cute characters, cute cute cute etc.. The price is also very nice (1$ or so); everyone can afford it. Depending on your skill, the game will take aprox. 3-4 hours to complete. There are 3 planets, with 2 worlds on each planet. Individually, there are 4 levels on each world. That's a total of 24 levels, with 6 different worlds (backgrounds). The music is quite nice, never being distracting unless you spend way too much time ♥♥♥♥ing around in one level. I wish there were more enemies and variety of weapons and puzzles.However, you should beware of some things within the game. For example, the game can't be played in full screen mode nor can the buttons be switched. The first issue can be fixed simply by pressing Alt+Enter to make it windowed mode. Another thing is an annoying bug on lava level 4 (last level). On the second checkpoint, there's a chance that the game will instantly crash on impact. This is kind of tricky to get past. The way I did it was to kill the robot previous to that area, and carry him to the second platform from the laser beam. From there, jump on the robot, pull the robot towards you and jump again so you get high enough to jump over it and past that checkpoint. There is also a chance the game with crash if you're hit by any other laser beams on the same level.Other than this, it's really worth the money. It's fun and mostly relaxing (unless you struggle or get stuck somewhere).Final rating: 7.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
												Definitely one of the cutest platformers I've played in ages, can't believe it was so cheap.  Sounds are adorable, gameplay is fun and challenging without feeling unfairly difficult.  Checkpoints are plentiful, lives and ammo are unlimited, item pickups are permanent, so it's not that difficult to at least make incremental progress through the fairly short levels.  Whenever I failed, it was generally because I was rushing and not taking it seriously.  However, this game is definitely not for everyone - if you play games mainly to relax and dislike being challenged or required to learn from failure, this might not be for you.Only criticisms I have are (and I'm only about halfway through the game so some of these might change)Physics gun can be really fiddly at times, sometimes difficult to maintain grip on objectsSimilar puzzles keep being repeated over and over, many puzzles feel a too simplistic (perhaps the real head-scratchers come later?)Lots of missed opportunities for more creative/challenging gameplay mechanics, for example you can kill enemies with physics but never need to, very little reason to use thrusters except "cross that abyss", enemies are either totally immortal or extremely easy to killAbsolutely no options whatsoever?

												As simple as it looks, it's… in fact a simple game xDBeep is a cartoonish designed platformer where you have to guide a cute robot through several planets to, as it name suggests (Built Exploration Extra-Solar Planets), explore them and search for nuggets of anti-matter. content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												This game is pretty cheap and also comes at a bundle that, when on sale, reach pretty absurdly cheap prices. And also gives you trading cards. But, if that's not enough reason for you to buy this game, let me tell you that, yes, this game is fine.It is nothing special, really, but it is pretty fine. This game is actually a cute 2D platformer with some simple mechanics that can get pretty hard later in the game. It is glitchy, but nothing that can break the game, you also can use the glitches as mechanics to help you get through the levels.It is a pretty straight-forward game, you play as a robot that have a shooting weapon and a grav. gun that can move things with your mouse. You'll use your mouse a lot in this game, that's how you aim/shoot and use your grav. gun.The music is fun and, as the rest of this game, can make you smile.A simple game, but it is fun, so, yes, you should try it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												Although cast with a whimsical, simple style of gameplay, and a Wall-E sense of innocence, Beep just doesn't offer anything beyond the basic experience. Your goal is basically to collect matter, and it doesn't get much more complex. You platform around like your average Mario game if you were wearing roller scates, you do basic physics puzzles, and collect the game's equivalent to coins.  I found it a tad on the easy side, and graphically it looks like something that came out of Newgrounds, which would be okay if it had substance. If there's any reason I played this for longer than 5 minutes, it was to get the cards. Steer clear.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2015
												Considering I only paid 19 cents for this game, it's going to stay.TL/DR: BEEP is a OK game, but not worth $5. If you REALLY have to have it, wait for a sale,Graphics: 4/10. Looks/feels rushed, can sometimes be hard to tell what is a wall or not. Each menu looks like a 30 second project. (Or a last-minute thing.)Gameplay: 6/10. Good ideas, but not the most straightforward sometimes. The Gravity Gun would sometimes not latch on properly and disconnect at random. The game itself also assumes that you know what you can or cannot shoot. I had spent about 6 lives trying to pass a set of lasers using a defeated enemy, only to find that I could shoot them. One level in particular drove me nuts with having to build a set of platforms, and then giving you a Rocket system once completed. Needless to say, I somewhat lost hope in it after that.Sound: 4/10 Not really worth writing about, although some of the effects do get annoying rather quickly. Overall: 3/10 At full price. 4/10 discounted. Utter confusion, odd/cheap looking graphics, and an overall rushed feel put down some rather great ideas.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												There's nothing particularly wrong with BEEP, but I think that's at least partly because the developers weren't innovating or taking risks with it, and ultimately, it just feels too generic and simple to hook me.  The gravity gun, touted as a unique mechanic and the game's main attraction, really isn't unique at all: it's functionally identical to, and used for puzzle-solving in exactly the same way as the wizard's telekinesis in Trine, which is a much more highly recommended game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
												I got this game for 18 cents, so that will probably affect my review.BEEP is a platformer with puzzle elements, I wouldn't call it a puzzle-platformer because of the puzzles revolve around you moving stuff around with a gun that lets you move objects. The art style, which was said in other reviews isn't consistant, it has decent looking 3D orbs (you collect these every level to unlock new ones) but then the background to the hills look like something out of a flash game.The most annoying thing about this game is wonky controls, you have to right click on the bot to reload, which is counter-intuitive when you're shooting at an enemy. This game is decent, should entertain you for an hour or two. I'd recommend it on sale but otherwise it's not worth the full price.
